articles.title: Disco Elysium writer was told "people covet these items more than they care" when pushing back against ridiculous merch

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
True to the word of Capcom’s German social media marketing, Monster Hunter Wilds has a new, generally less extravagant set of PC system requirements ahead of its February 28th launch. There’s also a standalone benchmark tool that you can download from the game’s Steam page, so you can see for yourself how the beast-biffing RPG will run on your hardware.
In theory, these are great developments. Lower requirements mean a more widely accessible game, and the benchmark tool – which covers a good six minutes of combined cinematics and simulated free roaming – brings reassurance and accountability to this otherwise hype-reliant prerelease period. Sadly, there are two problems. One, the benchmark confirms outright that Monster Hunter Wilds will run like stagnant goulash on low-end PCs, and two, it does so to the extent that I’m not sure that the revised minimum specs are even reliable.
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds brings hope with newly lowered PC requirements, then dashes it with a benchmark tool

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Paradox are buying Bulgarian game developer Haemimont Games, the developers of strategy games including several in the Tropico and Jagged Alliance series. The two companies previously worked together on Surviving Mars, which was originally developed by Haemimont and published by Paradox Interactive.

 
Read more
articles.title: Paradox are buying Haemimont Games, developers of Surviving Mars and several Tropico games

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The creators of sci-fi corridor explorer Duskers are making a "spiritual successor" to the 2016 space game. The studio revealed their plans in a video showing three prototypes they're currently working on. The working title for this one is "Humanity 2.0" and it'll see you carving up derelict ships to build your own vessel and sometimes defending that ship from pirates trying to take it over. It sounds like you'll still be the sweaty cybermaster of a bunch of glitchy drones, who now might suffer "fun personality quirks" when you install upgrades, "like not wanting to go down narrow corridors because it's now claustrophobic". 
Sad, busted-ass space robots just trying to get by? Yes, I'm interested.
Read more
articles.title: Duskers is getting a ship-building sequel years after the sci-fi roguelike scared us to bits

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Sci-fi battle royale Apex Legends is due a "meaningful update" , according to the CEO of Electronic Arts, something he's called "Apex 2.0". To a normal person, adding a 2 to the end of your game's name is the sign of a sequel. But as the attendant decimal and zero suggest, it's not clear if that's exactly what he means. It could mean a revamp with new features, or some other new direction for the existing game. His later words do make it sound more like this is what EA have in mind. Or at least what they're prepared to tell folks in a financial report.
Read more
articles.title: "Apex 2.0" is on the horizon, says EA boss, but it probably won't happen until after Battlefield 6

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Steam early access games that haven't been updated in a long while will now be more prominently labelled as such, according to reports. As noticed by third-party tracking platform SteamDB, Valve have begun adding warnings to early access info boxes, making it harder to accidentally spend your pocket money on a promising project that hasn't advanced in years.
 Read more
articles.title: It's now slightly trickier to accidentally buy a 'dead' Steam early access game

articles.author: Sophie Glass
articles.description:
When I’ve had enough of fighting the dogs in a respectable, straightforward manner, I pick them up with my mind and - with a casualness that has to be extremely insulting if you’re a dog - drop them directly off a cliff. This ends the fight immediately. Sometimes I resort to this low move out of frustration, when a dull fight has dragged on for too long. Sometimes I resort to it out of panic, because I’ve accidentally set fire to every hard surface within ten feet, or frozen myself to a wall. Often it’s just for the pleasure of it. 

In Eternal Strands, Yellow Brick Games’ debut title, you play the leader of a "weaver band", a crew of freelance magicians, in a world where something extremely bad happened to magic. Some years ago, the Enclave, a city state acting as the isolationist heart of the world’s magic, exploded in a kind of power surge - one part tsunami, one part blown fuse - and just as quickly sealed itself off from the world outside. Somehow managing to breach the wall, your band finds themselves the first people to set foot inside the ruined capital since the calamity and sets about uncovering the mystery of what exactly went wrong. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Eternal Strands review

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Hark, or whatever that is in Czech. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has earned Playable status on the Steam Deck, and it’s a shrewd assessment on Valve’s part: there are some shortcomings that keep the coveted Verified badge out of Deliverance 2’s reach, most notably its cramped UI, but I’ve been bumbling around the medieval RPG for hours now and it is indeed plenty functional in handheld mode. Despite its system requirements arguably suggesting otherwise, it can even manage some decent 40fps-plus performance without dumping all the quality settings to their lowest.
Read more
articles.title: Squint, and Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 looks like a fitting Steam Deck game

articles.author: Christian Wait
articles.description:
The first wave of Nvidia 50 series GPUs have arrived. Now they're gone. So, if you need an RTX 5080-prebuilt gaming PCs are currently your best bet of securing. While Dell has got some overpriced $5000+ Alienware 51 desktops up for preorder, there other (considerably cheaper, but not necessarily affordable) options up for grabs right now.
 Read more
articles.title: Amazon has a GeForce RTX 5080 prebuilt PC available now, at least while stock remains

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Vendrán Las Aves - "The Birds Will Come" - is a brief, quiet, hopeful game about burnout recovery. Summarised as a "slice of life tamagotchi" and available in Spanish and English, it's a gamejam production from Francisco Riolobos, Chuso Montero and Deconstructeam, the Valencia-based developers behind The Red String Club and The Cosmic Wheel Sisterhood.
It's free to download from Itch.io, and takes the form of a snowglobe perspective of somebody's one-room apartment. The person in question has just left their job after a rough spell, and has impulsively bought a guitar. They are also, however, totally exhausted, with barely the willpower to do anything beyond getting out of bed, let alone make music. Your task is to help them through each day and rebuild their morale till they feel able to pluck a few chords.
 Read more
articles.title: Vendrán Las Aves is a short free game about burnout from Red String Club developers Deconstructeam

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Hoo-eee! The sequel to the rootinest-tootinest gassiest-guzzlingiest racecar rasslin' game is launching into early access in March this year. Wreckfest 2 is the follow-up to smashing racer Wreckfest, which came out in 2018 but which I only discovered last year while listing our best racing games. My friends, it got on the list. Developers Bugbear say they have "overhauled its physics engine to deliver the most intense crashes, deeper component damage, and absolute vehicular mayhem." We can see a little bit of that in a new trailer below, which also gives us an exact early access release date.
Read more
articles.title: Wreckfest 2 is ramming through the barricades of early access next month and I will be waiting there patiently to get run over

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I don't end up covering as many classic point and click adventures as I'd like on RPS. That's a real shame, because every time I play a good one, I'm reminded how much magic the genre still has. Developer Blyts (Kelvin And The Infamous Machine) was kind enough to send me over a key for Slender Threads, which is out this Friday. My opinion as a complete non-expert on the genre? Yep, this one's absolutely worth a look.
Read more
articles.title: Slender Threads is an engrossing point n' click horror with old school charm, out this week

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Call me a cynic if you must, but I'm generally sceptical when someone claims to be "the greatest swordsman of all demons". It's the sort of boast most demon swordsman like to trot out, in my experience. And yet! I have to admit that this Gogandantess lad has a real flourish to him. He's going places, I reckon. Chief among those places being PC at some point in 2025, and he's bringing the rest of Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny with him. Catch him showing off in the below trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny remastered is coming to PC this year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Warhorse's medieval muck-o-rama Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 launches today. It's an engrossing RPG, despite developer co-founder Dan Vávra's tendency to throw his weight behind alt-right harassment campaigns. Also, a relatively bug-free one. 


In the course of my 51 hours as reviewer, I've encountered only a smattering of more significant technical issues. Firstly, some heavy slowdown while roaming Trosky Castle, the centerpiece of the opening Bohemian Paradise region, which I resolved by quitting and reloading. Secondly, a mildly terrifying moment in a dugout when a wounded soldier I was supposed to be treating struck a T-pose, as though afflicted by lightning early onset arthritis. And thirdly a repeated crash bug which I feel warrants its own article given that, together with Deliverance 2's eccentric saving system, it cost me several hours of progress.
 
Read more
articles.title: Ware ye this Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 crash bug that cost me hours of progress

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Several hours in, it’s become apparent that I lack the patience for much of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2’s much-publicised historical accuracies, like needing to bathe yourself every six minutes or how 15th century Bohemians can take several consecutive sword swings to the neck without dying. Ah well! If you’re going to play it, know that it’s also a decent performer on PC – despite the almost threatening tone of its recommended system requirements – and, as far as I can see, isn’t anywhere near as bug-prone as the infamously unstable original.
Read more
articles.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2’s technical touch-ups include DLSS, "Experimental" visuals and far fewer bugs

articles.author: Christian Wait
articles.description:
Dell’s new Alienware Area-51 Gaming Desktop lineup has landed, and if you're struggling to find a Nvidia 50 series, or you just want an all in one PC gaming package at (albeit large) simple fee, then this could be the way to go.
 Read more
articles.title: Alienware Area-51 RTX 5080 gaming PCs are available now, if you can't find a standalone RTX 50 series

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
If, like me, you failed and failed and failed to get a decent score in arcadey reaction game Super Hexagon, then take solace in this: there are a bunch of other games by the same developer you can fail at. Terry Cavanagh, also the maker of VVVVVV and Dicey Dungeons, is releasing a collection of his freeware bits and bobs on Steam next week, called simply Terry's Other Games. Looking at the games included, it summons a nostalgic giggle just to see just how many of Terry's short games have been intriguing enough to grab the eye of an RPS writer over the years. I mean it literally. One game is called Grab Them By The Eyes. 
Read more
articles.title: Creator of Dicey Dungeons, VVVVVV and Super Hexagon launches a big collection of his shorter games

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Peter Akemann - co-founder of Call Of Duty's Treyarch and recent president of The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners studio Skydance Interactive - has pleaded guilty to crashing a drone into a firefighting plane assisting with the recent LA wildfires. The crash, which grounded the plane by damaging its left wing, occurred after Akemann ignored temporary drone restrictions in order to survey the Palisades fires before losing control. Thanks, Eurogamer. For first noticing the case, I mean. I'm not blaming Eurogamer for the drone crash. Not this one, anyway.
The drone was traced back to Akemann, who has agreed to plead guilty to one count of unsafe operation of an unmanned aircraft. That's a misdemeanour that usually carries up to one year prison time, but he's "hoping to escape the prison term in exchange for 150 hours of community service in support of wildfire relief and the approximately $65,000 USD it cost to repair the plane," write Eurogamer, as part of a plea agreement.
Read more
articles.title: Treyarch co-founder pleads guilty to grounding firefighting plane with drone during LA wildfires

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Alice Bee (RPS in peace) covered the announcement for Forgotlings back in 2023. It's a metroidvania by ThroughLine Games, them behind Forgotton Anne - one of my favourites from 2018. Forgotlings, however, managed to completely slip by me until I recently noticed it had a Steam demo. This is such good news I've basically forgiven them for doubling down on the funky spelling.
Read more
articles.title: Forgotton Anne follow-up Forgotlings is a gorgeous jaunt into a mountain full of adorable weirdos - and it has a demo

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I was initially sceptical that we'd be seeing dark fantasy strategy RPG Whispers Of The Eyeless any time soon. I follow the game's creator Venris on YouTube. He's co-developing this with Evil Gingerbread Studio but his other big project is the Total War: Warhammer III overhaul mod SFO, and it seems barely a month passes without some huge update to that. Venris once told me he mods for around "eight to 12 hours a day", though, so I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that this cult-shepherding roguelite is now available in Steam early access. Edwin described it as "Darkest Dungeon, but you're running the dungeon". That's better than anything I could come up with, so let's stick with that.
Read more
articles.title: Whispers Of The Eyeless, the strategy RPG from the modder behind Total War: Warhammer's most legendary overhaul, is out now in early access

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I'm just so tired, man. Is this a dare? Because I'm basically taking the bait just by writing about it, aren't I? "The last carrier bag you’ll ever need," begins the description of this tribute to the plastic bag Disco Elysium's protagonist uses to collect bottles to exchange for cash at Martinet's local off-licence. "Frittte brings reassurance that the bag will serve your everyday needs on the toughest streets."
This nod to people whose main takeaway from Fight Club was how rad Brad Pitt's taste in shirts was is being sold by ZA/UM's collobrative merch store with company Atelier. They've previously put out things like a replica of Kim Kitsuragi's jacket. I'm not going to link them, as a pathetic act of rebellion.
As the man who couldn't afford an ambulance to get the gash on his head sewn up once said, let's try and keep an open mind about this. The bag's Dyneema fabric "is up to 15x stronger than steel on a weight-for-weight basis and provides the highest tear and tensile strength of any competing materials".
Read more
articles.title: You, too, can cosplay poverty with this €159 Disco Elysium carrier bag

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I had trouble sleeping last night, due to a combination of press trip excitement, chugging too many complimentary coffees, and my hotel room being opposite a strange, insistently symmetrical building that reared over my dreams like Sauron’s penthouse. So to settle my nerves, I got up and played a game about being a horrible tree. Just the worst tree. A total shit of a tree. That game was Roots Devour - and great news, if you’re having trouble sleeping you can play it too, for there is a demo in the wilds.
 
Read more
articles.title: Roots Devour's demo harbours the seeds of a brilliant horror card RPG

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Watch out for that falling breezeblock! It's about to-- ah, too late, you've been donked. A clip of loud wreckage, gunfire, and bazooka'd buildings has fallen dustily into our lap via a promotional video for Battlefield 6 (or whatever the developers plan to call the next of these large-scale first-person shooters). Mostly, it's a lot of producers talking a big game about "levelling up" the "core experience", which seems to remain blasting a building you don't like with a rocket-propelled grenade. We can tell from the final 10 seconds of the video, which show some of the game's actual running and/or gunning.
Read more
articles.title: Battlefield 6's crumbling warzones are teased in a promo vid calling for playtesters

articles.author: Christian Wait
articles.description:
The battle for medieval Bohemia is about to kick off again with Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, launching on February 4, 2025. Fanatical has a cracking preorder deal that saves you some coin while guaranteeing your Steam key will be delivered on or before release day. No nonsense, no delays, just instant access to swords, shields, and questionable 15th-century hygiene.
 Read more
articles.title: You can save 10% on your Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Steam pre-order if you buy it today

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Once upon a time, Alice B (RPS in peace) was frustrated that the villagers in Early Access medieval townbuilder Foundation would not eat their bread and were furiously starving. Then it turned out Alice was the one starving them. Hoho! Pure japes.

Five years later, Foundation has just hit 1.0.

 
Read more
articles.title: Foundation, the gridless medieval townbuilder, has hit 1.0 after five years of Early Access

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
After several hours of battles, sieges, imprisonment and torture in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, a groggy Henry of Skalitz is woken by a servant girl in a castle outside Kuttenberg. She greets him like a nobleman. I have Henry push back. He's a blacksmith's son. He might have some blue blood care of his biological father, but he grew up in the soot and clamour of the forge. The girl nervously insists, however: Henry must be from the upper crust, or he wouldn't have been welcomed and feasted by the lord of the estate. He wouldn't be lying in his very own chamber with its very own hole for shitting in - and in any case, it's more than her job's worth to treat him otherwise. In a timid, not quite spiteful show of reverse class policing, she refuses to end the dialogue until she's dismissed in a manner befitting her station.
 Read more
articles.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 review: a bastard for all seasons

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Minecraft recently dropped pig variants into beta, giving porkly variants in cold and warm climates. The other barnyard animals were presumably breighing and neighing from the neglect, but here comes a solution: cows are getting cold cow and warm cow variants, too.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft now has cold and warm cow variants to join the pigs in beta

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
There was a moment in gaming history when it looked like all games would succumb to the dullest colours imaginable: brown and grey. Resident Evil 4, Fallout 3, Gears Of War - all bleary examples of a grubby visual style. This peaked in Clive Barker's Jericho, a shooter so desaturated it felt like the colour settings on your monitor were banjaxed. I have heard this called "the piss filter" and generally lamented in industry circles. But it was always a puposeful choice, intended to add some grittiness to the world. And there's at least one developer who is reviving "smeared dirt" as an art direction. As Time Surrenders is a very brown stealth game that takes a lot of inspiration from Metal Gear Solid V.
Read more
articles.title: As Time Surrenders is a dirt-filtered stealth 'em up lurking in the shadows of Metal Gear Solid V

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Friendly skateboarding game OlliOlli World and its rollerskating gun friend Rollerdrome have been delisted on Steam for unknown reasons. If you go to the store page for OlliOlli World, you'll currently see the classic delisted message: "Notice: OlliOlli World is no longer available on the Steam store." The same thing appears on the Rollerdrome page. No, we're not sure why. 
Read more
articles.title: OlliOlli World and Rollerdrome have been de-listed from Steam and nobody knows why

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Get ye to the walls, pikefolk of PC gaming. We've had a languid and fattening winter with a quiet game arriving here and there to peddle its wares. But the calm times are coming to an end. The big releases now march towards us in droves. But they do not know what lies waiting for them in the moat. The slick scales of the Maw surface in the moonlight, groaning, waiting, sick with hunger for fresh releases. The battle is yet to start, but we will upturn the chumbucket of news into the water below. Feed it, for heavens sake. FEED THE MAW!
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sundays are for walking the dog, cleaning the flat, and playing Dune Imperium - always. I might also try to self-host a Minecraft Java server, though. Let's first roundup some of the week's best writing about video games.

Alice Bell, with whom you may be familiar, asked on Eurogamer: can a Steam profile be a real memorial for a lost life?

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
I wonder if there's a Rorschach test specifically tailed for games. So one person can look at it and see a blocky Minecraft village, another sees Illidan's face, and a third sees the concept of Inland Empire. Someone should make this a thing.
Not us though, we're too busy playing games, or doing other things that are less interesting than playing games. Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
As rumoured, The Sims 1 and The Sims 2 have returned to (official) PC stores. Kindly Uncle EA has taken a break from his busy layoff schedule to rustle up a pair of Legacy collections that include a bunch of old expansions. It's the very first time the original Sims has graced a digital retail platform, I believe - it was first released in 2000, back when people used to access the internet using smoke signals and semaphore. Anyway, here's the reveal trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: EA re-release The Sims 1 and The Sims 2 on PC as DLC-stuffed Legacy editions

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Nvidia DLSS 4 has launched under not-terribly-happy circumstances. It’s a mostly AI-powered technology at a time when mistrust in artificial intelligence, fuelled by underbaked applications and anti-creative policies, is at all-time high – not to mention how the new GeForce GPUs it’s released alongside, the RTX 5080 and RTX 5090, have immediately entered 2020-style stock shortage purgatory.
However, having tried it out in a few different games, I suspect time will prove kinder to DLSS 4 than the RTX 50 series launch has been. It is, in fact, a rather nifty collection of upscaling improvements that can help out older graphics cards as readily as the very newest, while building on DLSS 3’s frame generation tool with Multi Frame Generation (MFG) to send visual smoothness skyrocketing. If you care even the slightest iota for how your PC performs in modern games, DLSS 4 demands your attention.
Here, then, I’ll break down DLSS 4’s various tricks and components, looking at how they really affect performance – and whether it’s worth upgrading your rig to maximise compatibility with it.
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia DLSS 4 explained: Multi Frame Generation, the Transformer model, and the GPUs you’ll need to run them

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Warner Bros' licensed free-to-play fighting game MultiVersus - aka, the one where Velma Dinkley and Arya Stark can team up to kick Superman's face in - will no longer be playable online as of 30th May. It'll be pulled from Steam, the Epic Games Store and the PlayStation and Xbox stores at the end of its next season, though you'll still be able to get your fill of Bugs Bunny bashing offline against either friends or bots.
 Read more
articles.title: Warner and DC Smash 'em up MultiVersus joins the pile of dead live service games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The post-launch update and DLC schedule for Sid Meier's Civilization VII slightly discombobulates me, because the image above is weirdly reminiscent of Civ 7's own historical Age progression screens. But that uncanny similarity also pleases me, because I can now do the intro joke "all roadmaps lead to Rome".* 


In case you missed it, the new 4X strategy jobbo is out 11th February. Developers Firaxis have now sketched out plans for updating it, which extend from the usual balancing and bug fixes to a variety of new map types, possible multiplayer features and Age settings.
 
Read more
articles.title: Civilization 7's post-launch plans include free multiplayer and Age features and paid Ada Lovelace

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The creator of frying pan simulator Arctic Eggs is working on a fishing game that I am certain will replicate the act of angling in an entirely ordinary and accurate fashion. Its approach to hooks, lines, and sinkers will combine the fishing from Animal Crossing, Sega Bass Fishing, and Webfishing, says developer The Water Museum in a post on Bluesky. It may have a splash of Dredge when it comes to inventory management too. Oh, also, a strange man might imply you are "disappointing someone". Nothing to worry about. And the ocean may or may not turn completely red. These decisions have not been finalised. Everything is okay. It is possible the fish are safe to eat.
Read more
articles.title: The creator of Arctic Eggs is making a fishing game that I'm sure will be completely normal

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Hidden away on NASA's Golden Record, an interstellar archive of music, image and sound, there is a recording of a poem by Charles Baudelaire, Élévation, which describes the astral ascent of the soul. Well, part of a poem. Both to free up room on the disc and perhaps, to edit out "the vast sorrows and all the vexations" of the second half, only the first two stanzas appear. The recording in fact ends halfway through a line, which conjures up an intriguing problem for the listener, inasmuch as the thwarted rhyme scheme reveals that the piece is incomplete. A poetically-minded alien might be tempted to fill in the gap. A fancier alien who took a module in postmodernism might hail the poetics of the fragment. A resolutely practical alien who thinks poetry is for losers might read the whole thing, instead, as a set of incoherent navigational prompts, made up of loose prepositions - au-dessus, au-dessus, par delà, par delà.
 
Read more
articles.title: In lyrical limbo RPG Three Verses, you ask gods to help poets finish their poems

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Mandragora: Whispers Of The Witch Tree is a 2.5D Soulsvania from Primal Game Studio, in which you electrify, bisect or incinerate handsome, ravening night creatures in a world of heaped skulls and burning spires. Yes, I'm well aware that "2.5D" and "Soulsvania" are nonsense words, woven by pestilent market forces. Samuel Johnson is turning in his grave, I expect. He has risen from his grave and equipped himself with an ironbound dictionary and is even now making his way through the layers of the English language, hellbent on slaughtering every 'vania yet coined.
But never mind Samuel. Oversized rodents and spiders aside, Mandragora is notable for being written by Brian Mitsoda, writer of the original Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines and the former narrative lead for its sequel at Hardsuit Labs, which lives on in the hands of The Chinese Room. Primal have just announced a release date - 17th April. Here's a trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Vampire: The Masquerade writer's new dark fantasy vania also features vampires, plus screaming spiders

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Don't get too comfortable. As an RPG that puts you in the synthetic boots of an escaped robo-person, Citizen Sleeper 2 often has you on the run. It's a crunchy, dicey machine of vibrant world-building that sometimes forgets itself in wandering prose. A compelling universe to sail through, with more habitats and hovels than its predecessor, more stations and stellar gateways. It can't - for me - escape the dense gravity of the first game's compact storytelling and novel character building, no matter how often it funnels you from one space caper to the next. But it has a good time trying.
Read more
articles.title: Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector review: a sci-fi RPG that explores new space, yet I yearn for old ground

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Bioware released a statement yesterday. It talked of "turning towards the future". It dreamed of "a more agile, focused studio". Nowhere in the post did the word "layoffs" appear. But this is what the post was actually about. The closest it got to addressing the facts of what happened to an unspecified number of workers is the phrase: "we don’t require support from the full studio." 
It's one of the most disingenuous announcements of job cuts in a recent and plentiful history of job cuts. A weirdly impressive feat from BioWare, considering the last two or three years have seen some spectacular verbal gymnastics from games companies when it comes to shitcanning people. Let's take a look at some of our "favourite" mealy-mouthed press releases in which people have their jobs poetically "sunsetted" rather than, say, dropkicked out the window.
Read more
articles.title: Please, call a job cut a job cut

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The last Minesweeperalike I wrote up was a sparkling slurry of mind-altering pop-ups and resinous AI cleavage. It was David Cronenberg's Minesweeper: The Substance Edition, and I was sincerely worried that I'd put you all off Minesweeper for life. But before you mop your last munition and turn in your index finger for good, give Dragonsweeper a try. It's Minesweeper with an altogether less atrocious twist which you can hopefully deduce from the name.
 Read more
articles.title: Dragonsweeper is a free, neat and nifty RPG take on a venerable PC puzzler

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The layoff train has come for BioWare. A number of Dragon Age: The Veilguard staff are leaving the celebrated RPG company in the course of plans to become "a more agile, focused studio", as BioWare move ahead with the next Mass Effect game. Posting on Bluesky, senior systems designer Michelle Flamm, producer Jen Cheverie, editor Karin West-Weekes, lead writer Trick Weekes and narrative designer Ryan Cormier have all announced that they're looking for work.


All of which feels like it warrants a mention in general manager Gary McKay's recent blog about BioWare's future, but he comments only that they're "taking the opportunity to reimagine" how BioWare operate between projects, and "have worked diligently over the past few months to match many of our colleagues with other teams at EA that had open roles that were a strong fit." Which is a very slippery way to say that you're making a load of people redundant. 
 
Read more
articles.title: BioWare quietly lay off key Dragon Age team members while talking up the next Mass Effect

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Mere hours before it’s January 30th release – wait, that’s today! – Sony have finally spilled the beans on system requirements for Marvel’s Spider-Man 2, as well as the eye-blistering, GPU-rending special features that more powerful rigs can support. Happily, all these ray tracing and frame generation accoutrements seemingly won’t preclude Spidey 2 from working on older, slower PCs as well, as the minimum specs are surprisingly reasonable.
Granted, they’re only rated for 30fps at a lowly 720p, and you’ll still need to find a honking 140GB of SSD space, but the basic GPU and CPU requirements aren’t too lofty at all. The likes of an RTX 3060 for 60fps/1080p are quite reasonable as well, though you’re staring down the barrel of Nvidia’s pricey RTX 4080 and RTX 4090 cards for high-rez ray tracing.
Read more
articles.title: Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 system requirements and PC features are all things to all Spider-people

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Looks like they finally got the message. "An account for PlayStation Network will become optional for these titles on PC," said PlayStation in a short and quiet blog post that includes the upcoming PC release for Spider-Man 2, and The Last Of Us Part II. It's been eight months since PlayStation provoked mass annoyance among PC players by making a PSN account mandatory to play Helldivers 2, and later Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered. They soon walked back the decision for Helldivers 2 after a rough review-bombing but the company didn't seem to fully take the hint. It looks like they've now conceded that, yes, the obligatory sign-up was an unpopular move.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation finally drop the PSN account requirement that annoyed every PC player

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It's easy to feel pride when you're flying through space at 1000 metres per second. "Look at my spaceship go," you say to yourself, "look how fast it crashes into that other, smaller ship." Building your own galactic snowpiercer from scratch in Space Engineers 2 will bring a smile to anyone who once revelled in clicking together Lego podracers and bashing them into one another on the living room carpet with a violence eight-year-olds should not yet have mental access to. That said, this is the precise extent of the things you can do in the game so far. Build 'n' crash. Every feature fits in this opening paragraph. There's good reason to trust the developers' ability to deliver the rest of this crafting and survival game. But right now, it's all core, no loop. 
Read more
articles.title: Space Engineers 2 early access review: a solid and solitary box of building blocks - yet not much else

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Open world spec op gun-brandisher Phantom Line takes place during a paranormal crisis of such intensity that the outbreak of nuclear war gets relegated to bullet point five on the latest press email. Atomic apocalypse? Ehhh. That's a roadside picnic compared to what S.T.A.L.K.S this alternately Lynchian and Tarkovskian battlefield. You'll wish you'd been dusted by nuclear fire when you're being torn open by some kind of demon puppet in a labyrinth of red curtains.


If you do get torn open by a demon puppet, the good news is that players have a range of artificial bodies to choose from. Among Phantom Line's headline features is the HUSK system, which lets you switch between members of your squad right in the middle of combat. Unless, presumably, the body in question is already occupied by one of your co-op partners. If all this sounds appealing, the even-gooder news is that there's now a demo available via the developer Discord.
 
Read more
articles.title: Here's a demo for Phantom Line, the paranormal military FPS that mixes S.T.A.L.K.E.R. with Control

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
You'll have to bear with me for this one, because the press release we received for Demeo X Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked contains about an 86/14 split between scrambled hypeguff and actual tangible information. In brief, it's a VR collaboration between D&D traffickers Wizards Of The Coast and Demeo studio Resolution Games that aims to simulate a tactical co-op tabletop experience without any of the boring bits, like seeing your mates' genuine reactions to things or having your frigid digitised soul warmed at the hearth of human kinship. Here is - in a sense of the word so loose I fear imminent smiting by a bellicose scribe god for typing it - a trailer:
Read more
articles.title: Demeo X Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked is a VR tabletop tactics game from Wizards Of The Coast

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na úvodní článek o PIO na mikrořadičích Raspberry Pi Pico dnes navážeme. Pokusíme se propojit znalosti o PIO (interní architektura, způsob propojení s mikrořadičem i s GPIO, instrukční soubor) s vlastnostmi MicroPythonu.
articles.title: Programovatelné IO na mikrořadičích RP2040 – praktické použití

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Kybernetická bezpečnost dostává do nového rozměru, kdy umělá inteligence hraje klíčovou roli jak v útocích, tak v obraně počítačových sítí. Moderním trendům v bezpečnosti se věnovala konference BSS 2025.
articles.title: Umělá inteligence mění útoky na sítě, ale pomáhá i v obraně, zaznělo na BSS 2025

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Svrčina)
articles.description: S rostoucí popularitou Kubernetes se kontejnerová prostředí stávají klíčovou součástí IT infrastruktury. Tradiční přístupy k síťové bezpečnosti však často nestačí na zajištění potřebné ochrany v těchto dynamických prostředích.
articles.title: Síťová bezpečnost kontejnerů: proč nestačí tradiční perimetrové firewally?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes se podíváme na hvězdy v terminálu, procvičíme si dýchání, automaticky si vytvoříme dokumentaci ke zdrojovému kódu a přehrajeme si hudbu v textovém režimu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (12. 2. 2025): prozkoumejte hvězdnou oblohu na terminálu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Navážeme na článek o vektorových instrukcích na platformě 80×86. Popíšeme si další instrukce MMX, konkrétně všechny aritmetické instrukce, logické instrukce i instrukci, která kombinuje násobení prvků vektorů s jejich součtem.
articles.title: SIMD instrukce na platformě 80×86: instrukční sada MMX

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Ondráček)
articles.description: V předchozím článku jsme si nastínili, jak Knot Resolver 6 a Knot DNS 3.4 chrání samy sebe i ostatní proti útokům typu denial-of-service. Pojďme se nyní zblízka podívat na implementaci takovéto ochrany.
articles.title: Novinky v Knot Resolver 6: ochrana před DoS útoky – technické řešení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: Podíváme se na další bezpečnostní problém platformy DeepSeek, zneužívání veřejných klíčů ASP.net, distribuci malwaru skrze podvodné stránky Google Chrome nebo krádež údajů z prohlížeče severokorejskou skupinou Kimsuky.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: DeepSeek přenáší citlivá data nešifrovaně na servery v ČLR

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Očekává se, že příští hlavní verze Debianu, 13 „Trixie“, bude dodávána s desktopovým prostředím GNOME 48. Distribuce Void Linux oficiálně vydala svůj únorový obraz, který přináší podporu pro Apple Silicon.
articles.title: Debian 13 vyjde s GNOME 48, Void Linux podporuje Apple Silicon

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Týden v KDE přináší opravy pro tři budoucí vydání Plasmy, tři týdny v GNOME ve znamení Adwaita Sans či aplikací třetích stran, vydáno Wine 10.1 a opravuje spoustu chyb.
articles.title: Británie chce po Applu šifrovaný obsah uživatelů, Google zase ovladač Xe i pro Alder Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Letošní únorové vydání kancelářského balíku LibreOffice přináší desítky vylepšení ve všech aplikacích i společného základu balíku. Lépe pracuje s většími dokumenty či usnadňuje práci lidem s horším zrakem.
articles.title: LibreOffice 25.2 přináší ODF 1.4 či vylepšené rozhraní a podporu OOXML

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Výběr správného webového serveru může ovlivnit výkon webové aplikace. Server LinuxConfig se rozhodl změřit výkon nejpoužívanějších webových serverů. Do testu zařadil Apache, Nginx, LiteSpeed, OpenLiteSpeed, Caddy a Lighttpd. Otestovány byly různé podmínky včetně statické práce se soubory, velkého souběhu dotazů, stahování velkých souborů a simulací trvalého provozu.
articles.title: Test webových serverů Apache, Nginx, LiteSpeed, OpenLiteSpeed, Caddy a Lighttpd

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: T-Mobile je již tradičním partnerem běžkařského závodu Jizerská 50, letos poprvé tu operátor nasadil technologii distribuce mobilního signálu pomocí bezpilotního letounu. Unikátní řešení vyvinuté ve spolupráci s Primoco UAV SE je primárně určeno pro pomoc s posílením signálu při krizových událostech, Jizerská 50 pak poskytla první příležitost pro živý test na akci konající se mimo běžné pokrytí, uvádí důvody operátor.
articles.title: T-Mobile poprvé v praxi vyzkoušel mobilní vysílač umístěný na dronu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na dnešek bylo původně naplánováno vydání Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS spolu se všemi oficiálními deriváty. Na poslední chvíli se ale vyskytl problém, kvůli kterému bylo nutné toto opravné vydání odložit na příští týden. Nedopatřením totiž byly některé obrazy sestaveny bez jádra HWE.
articles.title: Vydání Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS bylo odloženo na příští týden

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Linuxové distribuce SUSE a openSUSE už velmi dlouho používají bezpečnostní rozšíření AppArmor. Tato společná historie sahá vlastně až do dob společnosti Novell, kdy se ještě AppArmor původně jmenoval SubDomain. Nyní ale bude v nových instalacích openSUSE Tumbleweed ve výchozím nastavení zapínat konkurenční nástroj SELinux (Security Enhanced Linux).
articles.title: OpenSUSE Tumbleweed přechází z AppArmor na SELinux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 13. února 1992 se tehdejší Československo poprvé připojilo k celosvětové síti internet. Český internet tedy dnes slaví své 33. narozeniny. Tento významný den připomíná okamžik, kdy se Čechům a Slovákům otevřely brány do nového digitálního světa. V roce 1992 stál za tímto historickým krokem tým odborníků z Českého vysokého učení technického (ČVUT) v čele s Janem Gruntorádem, emeritním ředitelem sdružení CESNET, který byl v roce 2021 uveden do internetové síně slávy.
articles.title: Český internet slaví 33. narozeniny

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Vláda Spojeného kráľovstva nariadila spoločnosti Apple, aby jej umožnila prístup ku všetkému obsahu, ktorý používatelia z celého sveta nahrali do cloudu. Vláda vydala minulý mesiac príkaz, ktorý vyžaduje všeobecnú schopnosť prezerať si všetky zašifrované dáta užívateľov.
articles.title: Británia nariadila spoločnosti Apple sprístupnenie šifrovaných cloudových dát používateľov

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Backblaze již tradičně nezahálí a tak jejich statistiky za rok 2024 zahrnují až 24TB kapacity sledovaných disků. Pozitivní zprávou pro zájemce budiž, že z 1200 kusů 24TB disků Seagate jim loni neselhal ani jediný.
articles.title: Backblaze statistiky poruchovosti HDD za rok 2024, včetně 22TB a 24TB modelů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ovladače „swrast“ (softwarový), ANV (Intel) a Panfrost (ARM Mali) spojuje jedna věc: jsou v projektu Mesa jako výchozí ovladače pro API Vulkan na příslušných čipech. Nově je bude – konečně – doprovázet také freedreno/Turnip, Vulkan ovladač vyvíjený pro grafická jádra v čipech Qualcomm Adreno. Jak konstatuje Dmitry Baryshkov z Linaro v příslušném patchi: kvalita kódu je dostatečně dobrá, aby byl Turnip výchozím.
articles.title: Turnip je nově výchozí Mesa Vulkan ovladač pro Qualcomm Adreno

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: zcr)
articles.description: Český LibreOffice tým vydává překlad příručky LibreOffice Math 24.8. Math je modul editoru vzorců v kancelářském balíku LibreOffice a poskytuje možnosti rozvržení pro zobrazení matematických, chemických, elektrických nebo vědeckých vzorců ve standardní písemné notaci.
articles.title: Český překlad příručky LibreOffice Math 24.8

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Terraform vám umožní spravovat infrastrukturu jako kód, to znamená verzovanou v Gitu, přidávání zdrojů pomocí merge (pull) requestů a mnoho dalších výhod. Ukážeme si, jak Terraform pracuje, jak jej používat v týmu a jak jím spravovat infrastrukturu.
articles.title: Terraform: spravujte infrastrukturu jako kód (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Intel zveřejnila nový mikrokód procesorů pro Alder Lake, Emerald Rapids, Ice Lake, Raptor Lake, Sapphire Rapids, Sierra Forest a další platformy sahající až ke Coffee Lake H. Aktualizace řeší pět bezpečnostních problémů a řadu různých funkčních problémů.
articles.title: Intel vydal nový mikrokód řešící pět bezpečnostních problémů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze kodéru pro formát Free Lossless Audio Codec, tedy FLAC 1.5. Hlavní a velmi významnou novinkou je zde podpora vícevláknového kódování pomocí parametru -j # či --threads=#. Na straně kodéru nová verze podporu pro řetězené Ogg FLAC soubory, dále přináší některé opravy, aktualizaci build systému a další drobná vylepšení. Došlo též k aktualizaci verze licence GFDL na 1.3.
articles.title: FLAC 1.5 s podporou vícevláknového kódování je tu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Očekávaná nová verze desktopového prostředí KDE Plasma 6.3.0 je na světě. Přehled novinek je k dispozici v oznámení na domovském webu, detialní soupis změn jednotlivých komponent pak v obsáhlém seznamu čítajícím stovky položek.
articles.title: Vyšla KDE Plasma 6.3, přináší snadné klonování panelů či lepší podporu grafických tabletů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Už třetí kandidát na ostré vydání přelomového GIMPu 3.0 je na světě. Seznam novinek je v podstatě nulový, ale opět je opraveno několik chyb a projekt je na dobré cestě k finální verzi.
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 RC3 je k dispozici, opravuje nedestruktivní úpravy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Čeští uživatelé desktopového prostředí GNOME byli vždycky zvyklí na perfektní lokalizaci do češtiny, kterou ovšem mnoho let vytvářelo několik málo odvážných překladatelů. Ti teď ovšem této své bohulibé činnosti zanechali a v posledním roce je to na stavu českého překladu znát. GNOME momentálně nemá české překladatele a pokud se toho neujme někdo nový, překlady začnou postupně upadat, varuje Jiří Eischmann na svém blogu.
articles.title: Projektu GNOME chybí čeští překladatelé, překlad začal upadat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Python 3.14 bude mít nový interpreter tail-call (koncová rekurze). V průměru je v testech o 10 % rychlejší,  v náročných testech scimark o 40 %.
articles.title: Python 3.14 bude mít nový interpreter tail-call, je rychlejší o 10-40 %

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář Isaac Gemal z New Jersey vytvořil WikiTok, což je webová stránka s možností nekonečného skrolování, jako známe ze sociálních sítí. Jen je náhodně plněna stránkami z Wikipedie přes její API.
articles.title: WikiTok - Wikipedie pro závislé na sociálních sítích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci  Google odhalili zranitelnost procesorů AMD Zen 1–4 CVE-2024–56161, které nekontrolují správně podpis mikrokódu. Lokální útočník s administrátorskými právy pak může nahrát vlastní mikrokód, který například upravuje generátor náhodných čísel RDRAND, aby vždy vracel číslo 4.
articles.title: AMD Zen 1-4 nekontrolují správně podpis mikrokódu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Projekt TrueNAS připravuje sjednocení svých dvou variant CORE a SCALE do společné verze TrueNAS Community Edition (CE). Připravovaná verze TrueNAS 25.04 s názvem Fangtooth bude představovat upgrade pro uživatele SCALE 24.10 i CORE 13.x a přinese nové funkce pro uživatele Community i Enterprise.
articles.title: TrueNAS CORE a SCALE se sjednocují do TrueNAS Community Edition (CE)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Od příští verze Firefoxu bude prohlížeč automaticky načítat stránky pomocí protokolu HTTPS. Pokud to u konkrétního webu nebude možné, přepne se načítání automaticky zpět na protokol HTTP. Tento způsob fungování je označován jako HTTPS-First. I když je toto chování možné v konfiguraci Firefoxu nastavit již nyní, není to zatím výchozí nastavení.
articles.title: Firefox bude od příští verze preferovat spojení po HTTPS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: V predvečer čínskeho nového roka spoločnosť Alibaba zverejnila svoj nový model Qwen 2.5 Max, ktorý patrí medzi najmodernejšie AI modely. Qwen 2.5 Max bol vytvorený pomocou technológie Mixture-of-Experts, ktorá umožňuje efektívne spracovanie úloh tým, že aktivuje len relevantné expertné siete pre každú úlohu. Po ukončení tréningu bol model vylepšovaný pokročilými post-tréningovými postupmi. Model je dostupný pod licenciou Apache 2.0.
articles.title: Nový jazykový model Qwen 2.5 Max od Alibaby

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O problému Windows 11 nainstalovaných z média vytvořeného mezi 8. října a 12. listopadu jsme informovali v prosinci loňského roku. Tyto instalace nemusely dostávat bezpečnostní aktualizace. Microsoft na řešení pracoval a včera se u problému objevilo, že je již vše vyřešeno.
articles.title: Říjnové a listopadové instalace Windows 11 24H2 bez aktualizací: vyřešeno

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera NowSecure podrobilo zkoumání aplikaci DeepSeek pro iOS. Zjistilo se, že aplikace z neznámého důvodu posílá nešifrovaná data.  Hrozí tedy jejich odposlech kýmkoli po cestě.
articles.title: Aplikace DeepSeek pro iOS posílá nešifrovaná data na servery ByteDance

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář Red Hatu Christian F. K. Schaller na svém blogu v pondělí napsal o budoucnosti distribuce Fedora Workstation. Zmiňuje zde, že by se do Fedory i GNOME mohla dostat umělá inteligence a zmiňuje open source IBM Granite.
articles.title: Bude AI ve Fedoře a GNOME?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: OpenAI přišlo tento týden s Deep Research jako s odpovědí na čínský Deep Seek. Jde o agenta, který dokáže samostatně vyhledávat na internetu a výsledky pak skládat dohromady. Nevýhodou je, že není open source a je jen pro platící zákazníky. Navíc zatím jen Pro a ne Plus a ne z Evropy.
articles.title: Open source Deep Research od Hugging Face

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Proč nepoužívat DeepSeek? Důvodů je celá řada. Při zavádění umělé inteligence je klíčová integrace dat. AI, 6G a pozorovatelnost pro autonomní infrastrukturu. Témata telekomunikačního sektoru pro rok 2025. Tržby z prodeje polovodičů vloni výrazně vzrostly díky zájmu o čipy pro AI. Rychle tvrdnoucí inkoust na bázi silikonů otevírá nové možnosti 3D tisku. Gartner předpovídá, že celosvětové výdaje na IT porostou v roce 2025 o 9,8 %.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Tržby z prodeje polovodičů vloni výrazně vzrostly díky zájmu o čipy pro AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Pomocí splývání černých děr vědci testovali symetrie vesmíru. Pauliho vylučovací princip slaví 100 let. V CERNu testovali, zda kvarky top vyhovují Lorentzově symetrii. Potíže s druhým zákonem termodynamiky.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Jaderný elektrický pohon by zkrátil cestu k Marsu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 6/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled lednových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za leden 2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI bude hrát prim v roce 2025 i u poskytovatelů finančních služeb a pojišťovnictví. Sodíkové baterie potřebují dalších technologické průlomy, aby mohly konkurovat lithiu. Spuštění aplikace DeepSeek by mělo být budíčkem pro americké firmy. Chytré kamery pomohou sektoru automotive k vyšší spolehlivosti výroby. Pure Storage v ČR svá úložiště nejen vyvíjí – v pardubickém Foxconnu probíhá i výroba. Generativní AI a LLM: (R)evoluce v umělé inteligenci?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Sodíkové baterie potřebují dalších technologické průlomy, aby mohly konkurovat lithiu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Kupte buď levný klíč na Windows 11 (OEM) nebo Office a jejich bundly nebo další software jako antimalware, hry atd. na tržišti Goodoffer24.com je kde toto všechno k dispozici. Žádné zkušební verze, ale doživotní licence!
articles.title: Levné klíče na Windows 11 a Office včetně bundlů a další software

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 5/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kvark gluonové plazma může existovat i v podobě malých kapek. Vrstvy grafenu by se mohly spojovat pomocí rotaxanů. Saturnin-1: největší fungující česká družice ve vesmíru.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Ve vzorcích z asteroidu Bennu našli všech pět dusíkatých bází z nukleových kyselin

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acer představuje nové notebooky TravelMate. Bezpečí je pro firmy při zavádění cloudových technologií nejvyšší prioritou. Adaptivní feroelektrické materiály slibují energeticky úsporné superpočítače. Threat Insights Report: rozkvět sad malware-by-numbers. Jak optimalizovat vyhledávače pro umělou inteligenci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Jak optimalizovat vyhledávače pro umělou inteligenci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 4/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kolik černých děr se ukrývá? Supervenuše: Webbův dalekohled potvrdil nový typ exoplanet. Bezpilotní letoun Toyoty začne létat jako taxi v Dubaji. Superpočítače Barbora a Karolina se chystají do důchodu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Diamantová membrána má vylepšit chlazení v elektromobilech i dobíjení baterií

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vývojáři openSUSE Tumbleweed oznámili, že u nových instalací se ve výchozím stavu přechází z AppArmor na SELinux. Uživatelé, kteří chtějí zůstat na AppArmor si mohou AppArmor vybrat v instalátoru.
articles.title: openSUSE Tumbleweed přechází z AppArmor na SELinux

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Hector "marcan" Martin skončil jako vedoucí projektu Asahi Linux aneb Linux na Apple Siliconu. Projekt ale pokračuje dál.
articles.title: Hector "marcan" Martin skončil jako vedoucí projektu Asahi Linux

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: PostgreSQL byl vydán ve verzích 17.3, 16.7, 15.11, 14.16 a 13.19. Řešena je zranitelnost CVE-2025-1094 s CVSS 8.1 a více než 70 chyb.
articles.title: PostgreSQL 17.3, 16.7, 15.11, 14.16 a 13.19

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Dnes je Světový den rádia. Použili jste někdy GNU Radio?
articles.title: Světový den rádia

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Před 33 lety, ve čtvrtek 13. února 1992, se tehdejší Česká a Slovenská Federativní Republika oficiálně (a slavnostně) připojila k Internetu.
articles.title: Před 33 lety, ve čtvrtek 13. února 1992, se tehdejší Česká a Slovenská Federativní Republika oficiálně (a slavnostně) připojila k Internetu

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 9.10 z Debianu vycházející linuxové distribuce DietPi pro (nejenom) jednodeskové počítače. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: DietPi 9.10

articles.author: ZCR
articles.description: Český LibreOffice tým vydává překlad příručky LibreOffice Math 24.8. Math je modul editoru vzorců v kancelářském balíku LibreOffice a poskytuje možnosti rozvržení pro zobrazení matematických, chemických, elektrických nebo vědeckých vzorců ve standardní písemné notaci. Příručka je ke stažení na stránce dokumentace.
articles.title: Český překlad příručky LibreOffice Math 24.8

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Backblaze zveřejnila statistiky spolehlivosti pevných disků používaných ve svých datových centrech za rok 2024. Ke konci roku 2024 vlastnila 305 180 pevných disků. Průměrná AFR (Annualized Failure Rate), tj. pravděpodobnost, že disk během roku selže, byla 1,57 %. V roce 2023 to bylo 1,70 %. V roce 2022 to bylo 1,37 %.
articles.title: Společnost Backblaze zveřejnila statistiky spolehlivosti pevných disků za rok 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Intel vydal 34 upozornění na bezpečnostní chyby ve svých produktech. Současně vydal verzi 20250211 mikrokódů pro své procesory řešící 5 bezpečnostních chyb.
articles.title: Bezpečnostní chyby v produktech od Intelu – 02/2025. Mikrokód 20250211

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 1.24 programovacího jazyka Go (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Go 1.24

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Zed code editor for macOS and Linux systems has proven to be quite popular for this Rust-based editor started by the creators of the Atom editor. Their latest feature being introduced is Zeta as an open-source edit prediction model to further enhance this code editor with AI capabilities...
articles.title: Zed Editor Introduces Open-Source "Zeta" Edit Prediction Model

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The latest round of Bcachefs file-system fixes have been submitted today for the in-development Linux 6.14 kernel. Besides fixes for the current kernel, it was announced today that the on-disk format for the file-system is now considered frozen in its latest development "master" branch...
articles.title: Bcachefs Freezes Its On-Disk Format With Future Updates Optional

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week Hector Martin resigned from upstream maintainership of the Apple Silicon code for the Linux kernel. At the time he was still going to contribute to the Asahi Linux project's downstream kernel but in a surprise move today, he has decided to resign as project leader of Asahi Linux...
articles.title: Hector Martin Resigns From The Asahi Linux Project

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Submitted today via the x86 platform driver updates ahead of Linux 6.14-rc3 on Sunday are some Lenovo ThinkPad patches that may interest some users...
articles.title: Linux 6.14-rc3 To Fix Platform Profile Support For Newer AMD-Powered ThinkPads

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those preferring the AOM-AV1 open-source AV1 video encoder over SVT-AV1, Rav1e, or other AV1 encoders, Google this week unveiled AOM-AV1 3.12...
articles.title: Google Releases AOM-AV1 3.12 With More Performance Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As a quick follow-up to the article earlier today... The Wayland Color Management and HDR protocol support is now merged to upstream Wayland Protocols!..
articles.title: Wayland Color Management & HDR Protocol Support Merged

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While there has been the recent drama over upstream maintainership over Apple Silicon / Asahi Linux code, Sven Peter is continuing to move things forward for the upstream kernel and this week sent out a set of Apple SoC DeviceTree updates intended for the upcoming Linux 6.15 kernel cycle...
articles.title: Device Trees For Apple T2 SoCs Slated For Upstreaming In Linux 6.15

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Similar to the Autonomous Performance Level Selection and Energy Performance Preference (EPP) support already found within the Intel P-State and AMD P-State CPU frequency scaling drivers for their modern processors, NVIDIA engineers are working on similar support for the CPPC CPUFreq driver that can benefit their Grace processor...
articles.title: NVIDIA Wiring Up Autonomous Performance Level Selection To Linux CPPC CPUFreq Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Today could finally be the day. In the works for 5+ years, the Wayland color management and HDR protocol additions look like they will finally be merged in the coming hours...
articles.title: Wayland Color Management & HDR Protocols Expected To Be Merged Imminently

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: SUSE/openSUSE has a long history with the AppArmor Linux security module going back to the Novell days and when AppArmor was originally known as SubDomain. OpenSUSE/SUSE and Ubuntu Linux have been big proponents of AppArmor for Linux security but now moving forward on new installations of openSUSE Tumbleweed it will be defaulting to Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux)...
articles.title: OpenSUSE Tumbleweed Switching From AppArmor To SELinux For New Installations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS along with new point releases for its derivatives had been scheduled for release on Thursday. But a last minute issue has delayed this release...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS Delayed To Next Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Along with the recently reviewed ARCTIC Freezer 4U-M for Ampere Altra, ARCTIC Cooling had also recently sent over their ARCTIC Freezer 4U-SP5 heatsink for cooling AMD EPYC 9004/9005 server processors within 4U rackmount height requirements. This cooler does a very good job at keeping even 400 Watt processors running well.
articles.title: ARCTIC Freezer 4U-SP5 Provides Effective Cooling For AMD EPYC 9004/9005 CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa 25.0-rc3 is out today as a rather large weekly release candidate to Mesa 25.0 that will be debuting as stable later this month...
articles.title: Mesa 25.0-rc3 Released With Numerous RADV & RadeonSI Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Given the recent patch proposal to raise the Linux kernel's default timer frequency from 250Hz to 1000Hz, I ran some fresh benchmarks looking at the 250Hz vs. 1000Hz comparison on some modern desktop hardware...
articles.title: Linux 6.13 Performance For 250Hz vs. 1000Hz Timer Frequency Comparison

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to the recent release of SysVinit 3.14 and systemd continuing to tack on new features, the GNU Shepherd system/user service manager written in Guile Scheme is out today with a new release...
articles.title: GNU Shepherd 1.0.2 Service Manager Delivers Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that the Linux 6.14 merge window has passed, new feature material aiming for the Linux 6.15 kernel is beginning to get ready for staging in DRM-Next ahead of that next merge window opening up around the end of March. Sent out today was the first batch of drm-misc-next changes for Linux 6.15 that include more work on DRM Panic for that Linux equivalent to Microsoft Windows' "Blue Screen of Death" as well as changes to the other smaller Direct Rendering Manager drivers...
articles.title: Linux 6.15 To Bring More Improvements To DRM Panic "Screen of Death"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A patch has been proposed for the Linux kernel to add a C1 demotion knob via /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpuidle/c1_demotion for more control over lower power state handling for recent Xeon Scalable processors. This C1 demotion knob can help with the performance of some workloads for Intel Xeon servers but at the cost of increased power consumption...
articles.title: Intel C1 Demotion Knob Proposed For The Linux Kernel To Help Newer Xeon CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The open-source Qualcomm Adreno Vulkan driver within Mesa known as "TURNIP" has now matured enough that it's going to be built by default when compiling Mesa for ARM64/AArch64 hardware...
articles.title: Open-Source Qualcomm Adreno Vulkan Driver Matures To Default AArch64 Mesa Driver List

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel on Tuesday released Thermal Daemon 2.5.9 as their newest feature release of this open-source daemon to help monitor and control the CPU/SoC temperature within laptops and other modern Intel hardware...
articles.title: Intel Thermal Daemon 2.5.9 Prepares For Panther Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Python 3.14 Alpha 5 is out today as the latest of many development releases in stepping toward the Python 3.14 stable release in October...
articles.title: Python 3.14 Alpha 5 Released With New Tail-Call Interpreter

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In the recent discussion over the GNU Gold linker being deprecated, there was the usual LLVM vs. GCC compiler/toolchain debate. Fortunately, with recently working on some initial benchmarks of the GCC 15 compiler I was following that up with some fresh LLVM Clang compiler comparison metrics on the same AMD Zen 5 hardware.

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If the latest rumors are to be believed, the Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC is set to appear in EA FC 25 Ultimate Team.


The latest rumor has been shared on X by @FutSheriff, and he could well become the first icon to appear as a SBC. So far, EA Sports has neither confirmed nor denied the rumor, but here are my predictions about the upcoming challenge.


EA FC 25 Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC release date (predicted)


The Grassroot Greats promo goes live on February 14. The Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC could be the promo opener, and it could appear as early as Friday. Typically, EA Sports has released Icon SBCs to begin a new promo, and the same trend might continue once again. If that's the case, the Stoichkov SBC could go live on February 14. 


Another possible date of release for the Stoichkov SBC could be Sunday, February 16. Over the last few weeks, EA Sports has released special Icon challenges in Ultimate Team on Sundays. Hence, we could end up with the Stoichkov SBC within the next 72 hours as of writing this piece.


EA FC 25 Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC costs (expected)


So far, we have no information about what the official card might look like. His Base Icon card is valued at around 130,000 coins, but the new card will be far more expensive. If I have to guess, the SBC could cost around 500,000 coins worth of fodder.


The final cost will largely depend on how many tasks are there in the SBC. I don't expect it to be as expensive as the Ferland Mendy Grassroot Greats SBC. However, it shouldn't be cheap (given he is an icon and expected to have two playstyle+), so keep some of your high-rated fodder in store.

The post EA FC 25 Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC leaked: Expected release date, cost, and more appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 25 Hristo Stoichkov Grassroot Greats Icon SBC leaked: Expected release date, cost, and more

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
During the main story quest Storm in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, events take place that result in your character having a pretty nasty debuff called Tortured. Here's how to remove the Tortured debuff and finally no longer be over encumbered.


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to remove the Tortured debuff


The only way to remove the Tortured debuff is to continue through the Storm main story quest and completely escape Trosky Castle. Unfortunately, you need to rest in order to treat the Tortured debuff, but you cannot rest until you've completely escaped. Bandages and other aid items will not fix it, either.


Until you're able to rest and deal with the Tortured debuff, you'll have to deal with the negative effects of the debuff by fixing your encumbrance and potentially using consumables that buff your stats. It can be quite a pain navigating through the various Castle Trosky patrols both inside the castle and south of the castle at Apollonia while you have those Tortured debuff.


What does the Tortured debuff do?


The Tortured debuff essentially lowers all of Henry's stats in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2. The problem is, this often creates somewhat of a spiraling effect. Your Strength is lowered which lowers your carrying capacity, so then you're over encumbered, and it sort of snowballs out of control.


You get the Tortured debuff when being tortured during the Storm quest, but you can also mitigate and prevent it based on your answers. If you willingly give up your friends, you will not be Tortured and therefore will not receive the debuff. However, if you try to lie and fail the skill check, it will result in you being Tortured.


From a narrative standpoint, I certainly understand wanting to lie. But if your skills aren't high enough to succeed in the checks, you may just want to tell the truth, otherwise it will make the future parts of the quest when escaping Trosky Castle much more difficult.

The post How to remove the Tortured debuff in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to remove the Tortured debuff in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If you're playing Pokémon Go during Valentine's Week, you'll be able to enjoy the Hoopa Unbound Raid Day, where you'll have plenty of chances to get the special Pokémon and add it to your in-game collection.


The developers have officially announced the date and time, which will be over the upcoming weekend. Let's review all the important information you need to know before participating in the Raid Day festivities.


Pokémon Go Hoopa Unbound Raid Day Date


The Pokémon Go Hoopa Unbound Raid Day will take place on Saturday, February 15. There will be a three-hour window for the players to try to catch Hoopa Unbound, the spawn rates of which will dramatically appear. You'll be able to enjoy the event between 2 pm and 5 pm local time.


During the event, Hoopa Unbound will be spawning at gyms as a 5-star raid. The frequency of such raids will also increase during the event, making it easier for you to catch. Thanks to the update, you can switch between Hoopa's Confined and Unbound forms.




Pokémon Go Hoopa Unbound Raid Day Bonuses


There will be a set of bonuses applicable throughout the event of the Raid, allowing you to complete more raids.



You'll get five extra Raid Passes for free, taking your total to seven.


You can also use up to 20 Remote Raid Passes between 5 pm PST on February 14 and 8 pm PST on February 15.



You will also have the chance to buy an additional Raid Day Ticket from the shop if you're willing to get involved with microtransactions. For $5, you'll get the following benefits.



Eight Raid Passes for free from Pokémon Gyms.


Higher chances of getting Rare Candy XL after completing raid battles.


50% more XP when you complete a Raid battle.


2x Stardust after completing a Raid battle.



That's all you need to know about the upcoming Raid Day. Use all your tickets to maximize your chances of getting Hoopa Unbound.

The post Pokémon Go Hoopa Unbound Raid Day Guide appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Pokémon Go Hoopa Unbound Raid Day Guide

articles.description:
The Ferland Mendy Grassroot Greats SBC could be an amazing piece of content coming to EA FC 25 Ultimate Team if the recent rumors are to be believed.


The recent rumor has been shared on X by @fifa_romania, and he could be one of the best SBCs of the upcoming promo. So far, EA Sports has remained tight-lipped about the upcoming challenge, but here are my predictions about the SBC.


EA FC 25 Ferland Mendy Grassroot Greats SBC release date (predicted)


The Ferland Mendy Grassroot Greats SBC could be the big promo opener we have been waiting for. The Grassroot Greats promo goes live on Friday, February 14, and we could be getting the Mendy SBC on the same night.


I doubt that the SBC will be released during the weekend, as other leaks like Kante Grassroot Greats SBC have higher chances of appearing on Saturday or Sunday. That said, EA Sports can always tweak the regular schedule, and a potential release next week can't yet be ruled out.


EA FC 25 Ferland Mendy Grassroot Greats SBC costs (expected)


Ferland Mendy might be a defender but don't expect the SBC to be cheap. Mendy has historically been one of the most meta cards to use in Ultimate Team, and I don't see that changing in Ultimate Team with the upcoming SBC card.


The official stats and playstyles have yet to be revealed at the time of writing, but he will be a big SBC. If you have plans to complete it, I would prepare to keep at least 700,000 coins worth of fodder. A Mendy item with two playstyle+, irrespective of in-game stats, will be pricey.


Once the SBC is live, we will have a dedicated guide available for you to complete the challenge and unlock the card. Check out this list of promo cards that are rumored to appear as part of the Grassroot Greats promo.

In previous Civilization games, the main point of healing units was to, well, restore some health so they could go back to fighting or scouting the map. While this is also the case in Civilization 7, there's an added feature of needing to heal units before deleting them.  


How to heal units in Civilization 7


Civilization 7 offers two ways to heal your units over time:



Skip their turn


Heal the unit over time



When you first select a unit on the field, you'll find options to build temporary fortifications, move to a specified location, or skip their turn. Skipping a unit's turn gives them some time to rest and restore their health, becoming active after you end the turn and move on to the next.


Alternatively, you can use a separate healing order through a secondary unit menu. To…

articles.description:
The N'Golo Kante Grassroot Greats SBC has been leaked on X by @Fut_scoreboard ahead of the promo's launch, and you will be able to complete the challenge pretty soon in EA FC 25 Ultimate Team.


The Frenchman is a popular name in the Ultimate Team community, and the upcoming card's inclusion in an SBC makes it easier for players to obtain him as well.


EA FC 25 N'Golo Kante Grassroot Greats SBC release date (expected)


The Grassroot Greats promo will go live on Friday, February 14. This will be a week-long promo, so it's guaranteed that the release date won't be too far away. There's a great chance for EA Sports to release the SBC on the opening night of the promo (February 14) at 6 pm UK time.


However, there's also a strong chance for it to appear during the weekend. Typically, EA Sports releases big promo SBCs on Saturdays and Sundays. Hence, be on the lookout for February 15 and February 16.


EA FC 25 N'Golo Kante Grassroot Greats SBC costs (predicted)


Thankfully, the leakers have revealed the official stats and playstyles of the card. Here's what the card should look like if the rumors turn out to be true.



Overall: 90


Position: CDM


Pace: 86


Shooting: 70


Passing: 82


Dribbling: 87


Defense: 90


Physicality: 85


Playstyle+: Press Proven+, Anticipate+.



If this SBC costs between 300,000 and 350,000 coins worth of fodder, it will offer great value for players. I predict the SBC will cost around 450,000 coins since Kante is always a popular choice. If the overall rating turns out to be 90, there's a chance for the SBC to be slightly cheaper as well.

How to burn the brambles in Avowed’s ‘On Strange Shores’ quest


Look above where the brambles are and you’ll see a little plant growing with glowing orange fruits called Magran’s Fury. Hitting this will cause the fruits to drop and set fire to the brambles below. You can’t hit them with your melee weapon, as they’re too high up.
